Point Kernel Deep Neural Network
  • Modules of pkdnn
  • pkdnn package
  • View page source

pkdnn package

Submodules

Here you can find the modules available in pkdnn.

pkdnn.build_database module

The build_database module is used for creating database files from binary files containing a meshtal MCNP result. To use build_database module, a ‘.yaml’ file has to be used as the one present in /examples/input_process_example/config.yaml. Into this ‘.yaml’ file, the path to a binary databse file has to be given. To run the command:

$ pkdnn.build_database.exe --config [path_to_config_file]

pkdnn.build_database.main()[source]

Converts binary MCNP files into the database use for pkdnn training.

To run this command, a ‘.yaml’ file should be provided with the following specifications:

  • inputs : a list of string providing the inputs of the database among the possible ones.

  • output : a string containing the output type of the database.

  • database_folder_path: absolute path to the folder in which the user want to store the database files.

  • raw_path : absolute path to the folder in which are stored the binary files containing the MCNP meshtal results.

  • mesh_dim: list of integers containing the number of voxels on x,y and z in the mesh.

  • p0 : wall coordinate of the axis perpendicular to it.

  • wall_normal : normal to the wall.

  • source : coordinate of the source.

  • atomic_number: list of atomic numbers of the elements of the wall’s material.

  • mass_fraction: list of the mass fraction of the elements of the wall’s material.

  • ro : density of the wall’s material.

  • path_to_dose_conversion : absolute path to the flux to dose conversion factors.

  • path_to_mass_att_coeff : absolute path to the mass attenuation coefficients of the wall’s material.

pkdnn.build_database.write_specifics(config)[source]

Writes a text file containing the output and the input present in the database folder

Parameters:

config ('.yaml') – the path to the ‘.yaml’ file

pkdnn.exportmodel module

The exportmodel module exports a Neural Network saved as a ‘.pt’ file to a compatible file (‘.dat’) for usage into NACARTE. To use export module, a ‘.yaml’ file has to be used as the one present in /examples/export_example/config.yaml. To run the command: $ exportpkdnn.exe --config [path_to_config_file]

pkdnn.exportmodel.main()[source]

pkdnn.predict module

The predict module is used for checking the prediction of Neural Network. To use prediction module, a ‘.yaml’ file has to be used as the one present in /examples/predict_example/config.yaml. Into this ‘.yaml’ file, the path to a binary databse file has to be given. To run the command: $ predictipkdnn.exe --config [path_to_config_file]

pkdnn.predict.main()[source]

pkdnn.train module

The train module is used for training a Point Kernel Neural Network for a specific database. To use train module, a ‘.yaml’ file has to be used as the one present in /examples/train_example/config.yaml. Into this ‘.yaml’ file, the path to a binary databse file has to be given. To run the command: $ predictipkdnn.exe --config [path_to_config_file]

pkdnn.train.input_data_processing(config)[source]
pkdnn.train.main()[source]
pkdnn.train.set_environment(config)[source]
pkdnn.train.set_training_vars(config, model)[source]
